review_title: Overall Pretty Decent, but Heavy Pace of Change
pros: Considering the non-profit world, Silvera is a pretty decent and put together organization to work for. The pay is slight better than average, and the benefits are quite a bit better than their competitors. For now, they are somewhat flexible with working locations and/or remote options.
cons: There is a large disparty between front line staff and administration/leadership. In administration/coordinator roles, it is also hard to see how you could be internally promoted. There are a lot of coordinator roles, but then it skips to Senior Manager - no middle growing stage (pay or otherwise). While the CEO and newer leadership seem to have great long term vision for the organization, day to day its hectic and constantly changing - not much consulation is done with those in roles that are changed so rapidly, down in the trenches. High expectations for occupancy, and pressure to retain residents - burn out is often just around the corner. Some people seem to stay a long time, probably for the pension, but at the cost of little to no pay increases you would stay stagnant for most of your career. We are supposed to house low income seniors and advocate for more affordable options, when in reality the income from working here will make us in need of their services in the future.

review_title: Silvera is not worth your time and energy
pros:
I enjoyed working with most of the maintenance staff.
The benefits are good.
cons:
Management is horrible. You get no answers. Supervisors are hand picked from previous jobs. Thus, favoritism. 
Training is poor. Supervisors are incapable of allocating certain buildings to those gaining experience from those who have gained a lot of experience. 
There are no advancements. 
Environment is toxic, no positive feedback or constructive criticism. If you do something incorrect, you are pulled aside and given a warning. 
There are a couple of maintenance guys who are favored and given a free pass on many things.  There is no knowledgeable support from supervisors and managers.

review_title: My time working at Silvera was disappointing.
pros: Salary and benefits. The work was interesting and at times very challenging. Most of the employees are nice and very respectful towards each other. By far it is very rewarding to work with the seniors who after all we were there to serve them.
cons: No balance between work and home life.  Everyone is watching the other and reporting to management. No cohesiveness. Organization structure unclear.

Alot of gossiping and nepotism.  My manager got promoted from recruiter to resident manager within 2 years and all she did was cry and complain about the work!  Too many employees get fired for no just reason. ' Not the right fit'
